page.title: 03FARMING HORRINGDON FARM
page.content: The farm is owned by the Crown Estate Commissioners.The Blakes have had the tenancy since 1920.Once the farm was part of Claremont Estate. Mr.Blake has 216 acres.16 acres is not farmed. He has 4 acres of potatoes, 25 acres of oats,25 acres lost with A3 and 146 acres of grass. The farm house is 200 yrs old, the cowsheds were erected in the 1900s.The barns and sheds were put up by Mr. Blake. He has a herd of 100 beef cattle.(A Hereford-Fr iesan cross). Most of them are poled. They are sold at Guildford Market between 12-18 months. He owns 28 Suckler cows. For each Suckler a subsidy is given.Grass is used for grazing as well as hay.Ear tags are used for identification. Potatoes are grown and bagged to sell to the public.It is a marginal farm. Herbicides used to kill weeds.
